Provision.Text: His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Finance, pursuant to section 115a of the Customs Tariffb, makes the annexed Ferry-Boats Remission Order, 2016.

Section.Text: TEST Remission is granted of the customs duties paid or payable under the Customs Tariff in respect of ferry-boats, classified under subheading No. 8901.10 in the List of Tariff Provisions set out in the schedule to the Customs Tariff, excluding those produced in Canada that have been exported and then subsequently re-imported into Canada.
The remission is granted on the following TEST conditions:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the ferry-boat was permanently imported into Canada for the first time on or after October 1, 2015;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a claim for remission is made by the importer to the Minister of Public Safety and Emergency Preparedness within two years after the date of importation; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the importer files, on request, all evidence that is required by the Canada Border Services Agency to determine eligibility for remission.

Heading.TitleText: Consequential Amendments to the Ferry-Boats, Tankers and Cargo Vessels Remission Order, 2010

Section.Text: The title of the Ferry-Boats, Tankers and Cargo Vessels Remission Order, 20101 is replaced by the following:

AmendedText.OriginatingRef: Tankers and Cargo Vessels Remission Order, 2010

Section.Text: The definition imported into Canada in section 1 of the Order is replaced by the following:

Definition.Text: imported into Canada, in respect of tankers and cargo vessels, means permanently imported into Canada for the first time, but does not apply to tankers or cargo vessels produced in Canada that have been exported and then subsequently re-imported into Canada. (importé au Canada)

Section.Text: Section 2 of the Order is replaced by the following:

Remission of the customs duties paid or payable under the Customs Tariff is granted in respect of tankers classified under subheading No. 8901.20 in the List of Tariff Provisions set out in the schedule to the Customs Tariff and cargo vessels.
Paragraphs 3(a) to (c) of the Order is replaced by the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the tanker or cargo vessel was imported into Canada on or after January 1, 2010;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a claim for remission is made by the importer to the Minister of Public Safety and Emergency Preparedness within two years after the date of importation; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the importer files, on request, all evidence that is required by the Canada Border Services Agency to determine eligibility for remission.

Subsection.Text: This Order, except for sections 3 to 6, comes into force on the day on which it is registered.
Sections 3 to 6 come into force on October 1, 2017.
